Question: 'what is the marks distribution of the exams?'
Answers:
Theory Subjects
Semester End Examination: 70 marks
Internal Assessment: 30 marks
    Breakdown within Internal Assessment:
        Written Test: 20 marks
        Attendance: 5 marks
        Behavioural Conduct: 5 marks
Practical Subjects
Semester End Practical Examination: 70 marks
Internal Assessment: 30 marks
    Breakdown within Internal Assessment:
        Internal Practical: 20 marks
       Viva-Voce: 5 marks
        Practical File: 5 marks
Grading
Uses CBCS grading with letter grades & grade points (10-point scale).

Question: does medical leave counts in attendance?'
Answers: Students are asked to submit an application and a medical certificate if their attendance is less than mandatory i.e. 75%.'

Question: 'What happens in case of attendance shortage?'
Answers: Students are asked to submit an application and a medical certificate if their attendance is less than mandatory i.e. 75%. In case of no medical certificates, an additional fee is charged or admit card's issue process may be hindered or delayed.'

Question: how can i get my id card?'

Question: 'how can I check my attendance?'
Answers: 'Students's attendance record is maintained in a register. Anyone can ask the teacher for their attendance percentage in that specific subject. Attendance percentage is calculated at the end of each month.'

Question: 'what documents are required for admission'
Answers:
Applicants must attach self?attested copies of the following documents with their application: 
1. Pass Certificate and Marksheet of Class X (10th)
2. Pass Certificate and Marksheet of Class XII (12th)
3. Marksheet of the last examination passed
4. If qualifying exam was passed earlier (specific year criteria), proof that the candidate did not take admission elsewhere and a notarized declaration about no legal issues (for certain qualification years)
5. Character Certificate from the Head of the last institution attended (original to be submitted at time of counseling)
6. If a private candidate, a Character Certificate from Superintendent of Police / District Magistrate / Gazetted Officer (certified after a specified date)
7. If applying under reserved category, an attested copy of Caste Certificate / CMO Certificate (original for counseling)

Question: Does npgc have study centers for distance learning?'
Answers:
Yes — National P.G. College does function as a study centre for distance open universities such as IGNOU (Indira Gandhi National Open University) and Uttar Pradesh Rajarshi Tandon Open University (UPRTOU) where students can enroll in distance mode programs and attend consultation/remedial classes on campus. 

However, NPGC itself does not offer its own distance learning/online degree programs independent of these open universities.

Question: Does college offers any hostel?'
Answers:
The college provides hostel accommodation for students from other cities/states.
There are separate hostels for girls (capacity ~155) and boys (capacity ~100).
The hostels are described as well?managed with discipline.
Hostel facilities listed include:
Internet access
Air?conditioned rooms
Generator sets
Water cooler with purifier
Geysers
Meditation rooms
Cultural hall
Common reading area
Common rooms with televisions (DTH)
Gymnasium & yoga center
Badminton court & indoor games
Mess (food facility)
CCTV for security
Medical facilities
Furnished guest house for parents of inmates
